data.title: Hungry Horse Reservoir Free Boondocking Site
data.meta_description: There are actually dozens of free boondocking sites along this Forrest Service Rd in addition to 3 campgrounds. The campgrounds were full so we found this site. No amenities but a nice view even though we’re considerably above the lake. Take the Road from Rt 2 to the Hungry Horse Dam. Drive across the top of the dam and any place you can pull off after that is OK.
data.text:
There are actually dozens of free boondocking sites along this Forrest Service Rd in addition to 3 campgrounds. The campgrounds were full so we found this site. No amenities but a nice view even though we’re considerably above the lake. Take the Road from Rt 2 to the Hungry Horse Dam. Drive across the top of the dam and any place you can pull off after that is OK.

Located right off Hungry Horse Reservoir on Forest Road 895H is this open gravel lot. There are a few self made fire rings. Fairly level.

Report Check-In

great place to camp. several sites but the first one off the dirt road is best for larger rvs. I'd only reccomand vans and small trailers beyond that. very safe and quiet here. please keep it clean! everyone else does...

Report Check-In

Gravel lot, mostly flat. Good gravel road off Hungry Horse west road. 1bar Verizon.

Report Check-In

I did not actually visit this site but I was given directions by a local National Forest Officer for sites all along this road. He instructed camping is allowed any place once you cross the damn. He did say 2 wheel drive would be fine as most are off a paved road (perk because less dust).

Report Check-In

There are actually dozens of free boondocking sites along this Forrest Service Rd in addition to 3 campgrounds. The campgrounds were full so we found this site. No amenities but a nice view even though we’re considerably above the lake. Take the Road from Rt 2 to the Hungry Horse Dam. Drive across the top of the dam and any place you can pull off after that is OK.

Report Check-In
